--- title: Pectoralis Minor --- :::{layout-ncol="2"} ![Intercostal muscles @OpenStaxAnatomyPhysiology2022](/The Archive/Images/OpenStax Anatomy and Physiology 2e/fig11.18 Intercostal Muscles.jpeg){#fig-openstax-fig11.18} ::: ![Muscles that position the Pectoral Girdle @OpenStaxAnatomyPhysiology2022](/The Archive/Images/OpenStax Anatomy and Physiology 2e/fig11.22 Muscles That Position the Pectoral Girdle.jpeg){#fig-openstax-fig11.22} ::: {#tbl-pectoralis-minor-oian .cell message='false' execution_count=1} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html}
Muscle Origin Insertion Innervation Action
Pectoralis minor 3-5 ribs Coracoid process Medial pectoral n.
C8 - T1		 Scapula: Depression, Downward rotation
Respiration: Assists in respiration
``` ::: ::: # Overview The pectoralis minor lies on the anterior aspect of the thorax, deep to the pectoralis minor @jonesProjectFoundations2025. The pectoralis minor is a 1-joint muscle acting solely on the scapulothoracic joint whereas the pectoralis major is a 2-joint muscle acting on the GHJ and STJ. # Origin {#origin} Upper margins @jonesProjectFoundations2025 of [3rd to 5th ribs]({{< var ref-rib-bones.path >}}) [@gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020; @jonesProjectFoundations2025] # Insertion {#insertion} [Coracoid process]({{< var ref-scapula-bone.path >}}) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Innervation {#innervation} [Medial Pectoral n.]({{< var ref-medial-pectoral-nerve.path >}}) ([C8]({{< var ref-nerve-root.c8 >}}), [T1]({{< var ref-nerve-root.t1 >}})) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Action {#action} - Scapulothoracic: - Assists in Depression [@gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020; @jonesProjectFoundations2025] resulting in the glenoid facing inferiorly [@jonesProjectFoundations2025]. - Protraction [@gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020; @jonesProjectFoundations2025] - Downward rotation @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 When the scapula is fixed, the pectoralis minor can act on the ribs @jonesProjectFoundations2025 and assist in respiration @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 The pectoralis minor can be used as an accessory muscle of inspiration @jonesProjectFoundations2025.
